page.title: 20RELIGION IN FENNY COMPTON.
page.content: {CHURCH OF ST.PETER 6 ST.CLARE}dates back to the Norman Conquest.The oldest gravestone seen is dated 1776.It seats 120 people, & Dr. David Pym is our new Rector.The spire was once struck by lightening,& was rebuilt with no new stone, so it is a funny shape.There are bullet holes in the main door from the Battle of Edgehill.One Rector was a half brother to King Henry 3rd.There are only 3 bells,and a lot of money has been spent in restoring the Church in 1985.The{Chapel}was started in 1838,& the font was presented by Mrs. R.Alexander in 1842. There's a balcony & a big stove for heating.It is very clean & very plain,and belonge to the Methodists. There are some Roman Catholics in the grid area, & they havw to go to Church at Avon Dassett, over the hill, which is very steep & dangerous in icy weather.
